parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3 </value></part><part><name/>=<value> Game
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.72</value></part><part><name>Game Version</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Applies force to given object at given position. Force is defined as vector [x, y, z] in world space, position is vector [x, y, z] in model space. If you need to define force in model space, use [[vectorModelToWorld]] or [[vectorModelToWorldVisual]] commands first. The force applied as impulse. For more information see [http://docs.nvidia.com/gameworks/content/gameworkslibrary/physx/apireference/files/classPxRigidBody.html#a22b0a1ef0b6c5656a6063c5c38f5679c NVIDIA docs]</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object '''addForce''' [force, position] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] - PhysX object </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [force, position]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> force: [[Array]] - force vector (in world space) in format [x,y,z]</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> position: [[Array]] - model [[PositionRelative]] to which force is applied in format [x,y,z] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER4</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value>  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER5</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p6</name>=<value>  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER6</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> Apply force [0,1000,0] defined in world space (not factoring object actual positioning) to object position [1,0,0]:
<code>_object [[addForce]] [[0,1000,0],[1,0,0]];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Apply force [0,1000,0] defined in model space (relative to object) to object position [1,0,0]:
<code>_object [[addForce]] [_object [[vectorModelToWorld]] [0,1000,0],[1,0,0]];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value>[[addTorque]], [[vectorModelToWorld]], [[vectorModelToWorldVisual]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>
